intro: Geranium bicolor, commonly known as the two-color geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features striking, two-toned flowers that range from white to pink and red, often with a contrasting color at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches, with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its showy blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
